title: JavaScript Variables
description: Understanding variable declaration, scope, and different variable types

questions.question: What is the difference between 'let' and 'var'?
options: let has block scope, var has function scope
let can only be used for numbers
questions.explanation: let has block scope while var has function scope, and let is not hoisted.

questions.question: What will be the output of: console.log(x); let x = 5;
questions.explanation: let variables are not hoisted, so accessing x before declaration throws a ReferenceError.

questions.question: Which keyword creates a constant variable?
questions.explanation: const is used to declare constants in JavaScript.

hints: Use const for values that won't change
Use let for values that might change
